unsolved: Spatial tracking of people and devices
device_mount: Placed loosely around user (e.g., table); Roaming (e.g., on robot, robotic arm)
scale: Room; Near, personal space; Social space
use_cases_desc: Creative tasks such as creating digital collages and comic strips in multi-device environments
evaluation: User study (qualitative); User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment)
contribution_desc: A study of how different interface designs (textual, map, and iconic) support application management in multi-device collaborative environments. Iconic user interfaces are sometimes the most efficient and preferable if the location of people and devices remain static. Design implications for application management interfaces include visibility, shadow of shared display, ownership of devices, roles of devices, feedback, control, and awareness.
crossdevice_def: Device: "Within an MDE, the term device is used to refer to a laptop, tablet, large display, etc., each driven by an independent, but networked system."
